channel.title: WTB axoloti core, new Mexico, USA
channel.description: Hi there. Trying to get one of these to start experimenting. Open to any offers. Mostly looking for one because of the similarity to a Nord Micro modular.

item.title: WTB axoloti core, new Mexico, USA
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

You should probably start a new topic for this. One comment - if you're new to Axoloti, you might have made the mistake of using the 2.0 Axoloti build.
Just say no. Install the Axoloti-1.0.12-2 build, and revert to the previous firmware revision.

Read full topic
item.source: WTB axoloti core, new Mexico, USA

item.title: WTB axoloti core, new Mexico, USA
item.dc:creator: @escortsaffair escortsaffair
item.description:
@escortsaffair wrote:

Just got my Axoloti board (Yeah !!)

I just tried it with the Linnstrument and I'm getting a lot of clicks and issues with it. I guess the Linnstrument's data rate via Axolotl's host port is too high....
Using the latest firmware of the Linnstrument I can decrease the data rate which seems to help but it's still not 100% reliable. Any other things I could change to help out ? (I tried both MPE examples)

Thanks !

Read full topic
item.source: WTB axoloti core, new Mexico, USA
